alert.note: Alert for Greeley; Howard; Merrick; Nance; Polk (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Hastings (North Central Kansas and South Central Nebraska)
info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued March 15 at 3:55AM CDT until March 16 at 10:00PM CDT by NWS Hastings
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Heavy snow possible. Blowing snow likely. Total snow accumulations of up to two inches possible. Winds could gust as high as 55 mph. * WHERE...Greeley, Nance, Howard, Merrick and Polk Counties. * WHEN...From late tonight through Thursday evening. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Areas of blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility, including near whiteout conditions at times. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning commute Thursday. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Precipitation is expected to start as rain that will transition to snow Thursday morning. Snow amounts will be on the lighter side, but strong winds will blow around anything that falls, reducing visibility. In addition, temperatures falling below freezing during the day may make surfaces very slick.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.
